title: Biostatistician, Pharmacoepidemiology
description:
Axle is a bioscience and information technology company that offers advancements in translational research, biomedical informatics, and data science applications to research centers and healthcare organizations nationally and abroad. With experts in biomedical science, software engineering, and program management, we focus on developing and applying research tools and techniques to empower decision-making and accelerate research discoveries. We work with some of the top research organizations and facilities in the country including multiple institutes at the National Institutes of Health (NIH).

Axle is seeking a  Biostatistician, Pharmacoepidemiology  to join our vibrant team at the National Institutes of Health (NIH) supporting the National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences located in Rockville, MD.

Benefits We Offer 

100% Medical, Dental & Vision Coverage for EmployeesPaid Time Off and Paid Holidays401K match up to 5%Educational Benefits for Career GrowthEmployee Referral BonusFlexible Spending Accounts:Healthcare (FSA)Parking Reimbursement Account (PRK)Dependent Care Assistant Program (DCAP)Transportation Reimbursement Account (TRN)
 We are looking for a skilled and motivated biostatistician/pharmaco-epidemiologist to lead Real World Evidence (RWE) course development for the National Covid Cohort Collaborative (N3C) under a new program: AIM-AHEAD. The N3C created the AIM-AHEAD program to convert the scientific, technical and methodological learnings into curriculum to help future investigators, researchers and collaborators. The N3C contains hundreds of treatment effectiveness studies using electronic health records and/or claims data to support projects at the NIH. Curriculum design activity from these projects will require expert-level pharmacoepidemiologists to evaluate, curate and prepare content. Publication opportunities may arise from the curriculum development focus. 

 The position will be based at Axle in Bethesda, Maryland, but functionally remote from US locations, with occasional travel. The successful applicant will be involved in designing and producing RWE curriculum using N3C observational studies in support of the National Center for the Advancement of Translational Science (NCATS). 

 The ideal candidate will have experience in the application of causal inference methods (IPTW, PSM, G-methods, etc.) and observational study designs (target trial emulation, self-controlled case series, test-negative design, etc.) They will have experience leading RWE projects from start to finish and as author for publications in the field. The candidate will have a deep understanding of the limitations of Real World Data (RWD) and various forms of bias and confounding that arise in observational studies (immortal time bias, confounding by indication, time-varying confounding, etc…). They will work with clinicians, biostatisticians, and other stakeholders to identify educational curriculum of significant public health importance. They will stay current with scientific and technical literature and remain informed about new approaches and methodologies, including participation in conferences or workshops, independently evaluating scientific resources, and potentially publishing scientific papers from this work. 

Responsibilities

 Develop RWE curriculum for AIM-AHEAD extension of N3C.  Collaborate with instructional designers to create new epidemiology courseware.  Serve as a RWE subject matter expert to Axle and NCATS leadership.  Implement recommendations from leadership on standardization, reproducibility, and data transparency.  Develop standards for the operationalization and fit-for-purpose use of Causal and AI/ML methods applied to Real-World Data (RWD).  Produce criteria to evaluate the incremental benefit of PPRL-linked datasets (i.e., improvements in the quality and/or scope of analyses, reduction in data missingness, etc.).  Participate in code and documentation peer review, integration, unit testing, and validation.  Produce exemplary material relevant to use of RWD including but not limited to treatment of missing data, case control selection, minimization of type I/II error, bias, prevention of model overfitting and poor generalization and approaches to Electronic Health Record data limitations.  Participate in preparing reports, visualizations, proposals and publications.  Present your work internally at Axle, to the NIH and at selected conferences.  Support investigations requiring biostatistical and/or machine learning knowledge and domain expertise. Outputs of these may result in publications.  Lead the design and execution of RWE studies using observational data and/or materials produced from AIM-AHEAD curriculum design. 

Qualifications

 Ph.D or Postdoc preferred.  Minimum MS in computer science, (bio)statistics, or similar quantitative degree, or MPH with experience in biostatistical programming and pharmaco-epidemiologic study design and fulfillment.  Proven track record of working with real world clinical data.  Familiarity with medical coding systems (ICD, CPT, HCPCS, NDC, LOINC, SNOMED, etc.).  Experience in modern machine learning techniques and biostatistics. Preferably experienced in causal inference methods, supervised, and unsupervised learning.  Fluent in R and Python with knowledge of SQL and data management. Systems biology modeling experience is a plus.  Strong oral and written communication skills and ability to actively participate in technical discussions and follow up on action items.  Sound judgment, positive attitude, and creative outlook required.  NIH experience preferred.

title: Volunteer: Short Distance Driver
description:
Since 1954, Guiding Eyes has managed to thrive on goodness, even in the most difficult of times. We relied on the goodness of our loyal base of generous supporters, passionate staff and dedicated volunteers to come together to meet the growing needs of our diverse community of people with vision loss. Through this unwavering support and dedication, Guiding Eyes has graduated more than 10,000 guide dog teams. We believe in the powerful, meaningful change that our beautiful dogs bring to the lives of people facing the daily challenges that blindness and vision loss present.

It can cost up to $50,000 annually to train and care for a guide dog throughout its working lifetime with a person who is blind. As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, we provide all services completely free of charge to people who are blind or with vision loss. At Guiding Eyes, we rely upon the contributions of our generous donors to fulfill our mission.

Guiding Eyes for the Blind has two locations Yorktown Heights and Patterson. 

Guiding Eyes for the Blind is seeking volunteer drivers to assist with short-distance routes. Routes will go between our Yorktown and Patterson locations, as well as to New City, Brewster, Hopewell Junction, and Newton, CT.

If you are interested, please submit our driver application via this link (copy and paste it into your web browser).

Campus Volunteer Application - Guiding Eyes for the Blind

Volunteers will use Guiding Eyes vehicles (the largest vehicle being a minivan) and must be comfortable transporting dogs and/or humans.

Volunteers will have to pass a DMV background check before starting.

This is a volunteer opportunity provided by VolunteerMatch, in partnership with LinkedIn for Good.
